etymology.description: 气(air; gas) + 泡(bubble; foam) = air/gas bubble.
etymology.interpretation: Combines the idea of air or gas with a bubble, referring to pockets of gas, especially in liquids like water or soda.
etymology.simplification: 氣 was simplified to 气 by reverting to the ancient graph ‘气’ (steam) and dropping the 米 component, reducing strokes and streamlining a high‑frequency character in Mainland usage.

parts.english: bubble; foam; to soak; to steep

examples.chinese: 水里有很多气泡(水裡有很多氣泡)。
examples.pinyin: Shuǐ lǐ yǒu hěn duō qìpào.
examples.english: There are many air bubbles in the water.

examples.chinese: 他摇一摇汽水，瓶口冒出气泡(他搖一搖汽水，瓶口冒出氣泡)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yáo yī yáo qìshuǐ, píngkǒu mào chū qìpào.
examples.english: He shook the soda, and bubbles came out of the bottle mouth.

examples.chinese: 潜水员缓慢上升，让气泡自然排出(潛水員緩慢上升，讓氣泡自然排出)。
examples.pinyin: Qiánshuǐyuán huǎnmàn shàngshēng, ràng qìpào zìrán páichū.
examples.english: The diver ascended slowly to let the bubbles release naturally.
